result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Bourbon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 8 Days, If Revoked.
Defendant IS eligilbe for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: Cash Bail Applied.  Paid In Full. Remaining bail to be refunded to poster.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Victim or Residence listed in the Criminal Complaint.
DNA Sample to be provided, if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packed, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Christopher J Bourbon in court with attorney Joseph Smith.   
Court to Address - Active Warrant for Non-Compliance with WCS.
Court Quashes Warrant - Cash Bail Reinstated.
Defendant's mother presented statements to the court.
 
Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 4 Years
Initial Confinement: 2 Years
Extended Supervision: 2 Years
8 Days Credit
Stayed

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


Term of Probation:  2.5 Years
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim or Residence listed in the Criminal Complaint.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250
DRGOD Surcharge:  $10
Apply Bail and Refund Balance to the posting party.

CONDITION TIME: 
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions)
STAYED until Monday, 11/17/14 @ 6:00 pm
After 90 days of compliance on huber - Last 90 days can be served through the Day Report Program.
